events.message: The insured reported a car collision that occurred on the morning of April 30th, involving significant damage to the front bumper and headlight.
Claim categorised under Auto Accident after review of initial report and assessment of involved vehicle damage.
An agent specialized in automobile accident claims was assigned to manage and assist the customer throughout the process.
Acknowledgement sent to the customer confirming receipt of the car collision claim and outlining next steps.
Requested police report, photos of vehicle damage, and a detailed statement from the insured to proceed with the investigation.
Customer submitted all requested documents including the official police report and multiple photographs of the damaged vehicle.
Investigation into the collision circumstances and verification of reported damages initiated by the claims department.
Investigation finalized confirming the collision details consistent with the insured's report and no dispute on liability.
A settlement amount was proposed to the insured covering the estimated repair costs plus a rental car reimbursement.
Customer expressed satisfaction with the proposed settlement and the clarity of communication during the claim process.
Claim was formally approved by the underwriting team based on investigation results and documented damages.
Payment covering repair and rental car expenses was issued and sent to the insured's bank account.
The claim has been officially closed following successful payment and customer confirmation of satisfaction.
All claim documents and correspondence were archived for future reference and regulatory compliance.
